segments.text: I can hear the water splashing and pooling, a constant reminder of the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It irritates me that the adult is oblivious, as if she's in a trance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not notice the mess right at her feet and the danger her children are in?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a surge of frustration knowing that something bad could happen any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are wide-eyed with excitement, completely unaware of the impending accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their giggles echo through the kitchen, mixing with the sound of water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to intervene, but part of me is frozen in place, waiting to see what happens next.
segments.speaker: PAR
